result.execSummary:
The defendant Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full or penalty of 10 days jail for non-payment.

Court waives DNA Surcharge and Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $914.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid at the rate of $50 a month, starting 08/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  10 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patricia M. Padurean in court.   
Defendant Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry did not appear.  
Attorney appeared by Authorization.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Order Denying - Defense Motion to Dismiss.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 04/08/16.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  
Motion filed by the Defense - To Dismiss - (Lack of Probable Cause).

State presented arguments to the court for lack of the defendant's standing to bring this motion.
Defense presented arguments.
Response presented.

Court is satisfied the defendant does have standing to contest the stop.
Reasons placed on the record.

Witnesses Called:  Officer Richard Helm (City of New Berlin Police Department) and Bienvenido Viruet Irizarry (Defendant).
Witnesses sworn and Testified.

Testimony deemed closed.
State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
Response and reply presented.


Court finds/orders the following:   Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds there is nothing in this record that shows the defendant was being detained.
Court is satisfied there is no extension of the arrest.
Court finds there was probable cause for the underlying stop and the search incident to arrest of Mr. Adams.
Therefore, court denies the defense motion to dismiss.
Court signed order denying.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.

  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

filed by Attorney Padurean requesting the motion scheduled on 4/8/16 be rescheduled to 4/14/16 @ 1:30pm with the co-defendant's motion.

3/7/16 - Court denied request for motions to be heard together. Attorney Padurean notified by telephone.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Phyical Evidence and Statements, received and filed in court, by Atty. Padurean.
Motion hearing on April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patricia M. Padurean in court.   
Defendant Bienvenido Viruetirizarry did not appear.  
Attorney appeared by authorization previously filed.

Defense filed an evidentiary motion (To Suppress).
  Motion hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Authorization to appear, received and filed in court.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patricia M. Padurean in court.   
Defendant Bienvenido Viruetirizarry did not appear.  
Attorney appeared by Authorization.  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any co-defendant cases.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no contact with co-defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Denied by Judge Maxwell 1/19/16; co-defendants have not filed requests.

Defendant Bienvenido Viruetirizarry in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Padurean indicates the defendants last name is Viruet Irizarry.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
